intro: Cryophytum, commonly known as the frost plant, is a genus of flowering plants native to South America. These plants are characterized by their succulent leaves and showy, often colorful flowers. They are adapted to cold climates and can thrive in rocky or arid environments. Cryophytum species typically have a short growing season and are often found in high-altitude regions. Their botanical features make them interesting subjects for both horticulture and ecological studies.
